about.description: The {{applicationName}} app is made available by {{healthAuthorityName}}.

callback.fill_out_the_info: Fill out the information below and a contact tracer from {{healthAuthorityName}} will get in touch.
callback.request_a_call: Request a call from a contact tracer
callback.success_body: Our contact tracers are working hard to keep you and your community safe. The {{healthAuthorityName}} has received your request for a call back. An expert will contact you within 24 hours.

covid_data.error_getting_data: Sorry, we could not fetch the latest COVID cases data for {{location}}.

errors.description: An error has occurred. Please reload the app.
errors.title: Unknown Error

export.complete_body_bluetooth: You’re helping contain the spread of the virus and protect others in your community.
export.complete_title: Thanks for keeping your community safe!
export.consent_body_0: Sharing your positive diagnosis is optional and can only be done with your consent.
export.consent_body_1: If you choose to do so, you’re helping others in your community make informed decisions about their health and playing your part to contain the spread of the virus.
export.consent_body_2: The only information shared will be the random set of numbers your phone exchanged over Bluetooth with other phones that were nearby during the past 14 days, along with a weighted risk score based on when your symptoms developed.
export.enable_exposure_notifications_body: You must enable exposure notifications to report a positive test result.

error.verification_code_used: Verification code has already been used

export.person_and_health_expert: A person talking to a health expert

errors.description: The operation could not be completed. {{message}}
errors.internal_server_error: The server is experiencing problems, please try again later
errors.timeout: The request took too long to complete
errors.unknown: Failed to submit the exposure data

no_op.no_token_for_existing_keys: Existing data was sent to the server. This usually means that this process was attempted previously from this device, but on a different application. You can communicate this to the authority that provided the verification code that was used. There were {{newKeysInserted}} new keys added.
no_op.title: Attempt to submit existing keys

export.start_header_bluetooth: Help contain the spread of the virus and protect others in your community

exposure_detail.header: Someone you were nearby has since tested positive for COVID-19.
exposure_detail.schedule_callback: Schedule a call to get support from a contact tracer from the {{healthAuthorityName}}.

exposure_history.how_does_this_work_para: When Exposure Notifications are on, your phone uses Bluetooth to swap and save random number strings (called random IDs) from any phones it is in close proximity to that also have Exposure Notifications enabled. Random IDs won’t identify you personally to other users and change many times a day to protect your privacy.
exposure_history.no_connectivity_message: You are not connected to the internet!
exposure_history.no_exposure_reports_over_past: You haven't received any exposure reports over the past 14-days
exposure_history.protect_yourself_and_others: Protect yourself and others in your community
exposure_history.why_did_i_get_an_en: Why did I get an exposure notification?
exposure_history.why_did_i_get_an_en_para: You will receive an exposure notification when someone you have been in close proximity with later receives a positive test for COVID-19 and chooses to notify others.

exposure_scanning_status.your_device_is_not: Your device is not scanning for exposures. Fix the issues below to enable Exposure Detection.
exposure_scanning_status.your_device_is_scanning: Your device is scanning for exposures and will continue to do so even if you close the app.

home.bluetooth_info_body: Your phone detects other phones you spend time in close proximity with using Bluetooth Low Energy. This allows the app to log your log daily encounters anonymously, even when you don’t have the app open on your device.

bluetooth.bluetooth_disabled_error_message: Go to the Settings app and enable Bluetooth to fix this error
bluetooth.location_disabled_error_message: To activate the Exposure Notification technology, authorize Location access in the Settings app
bluetooth.share_message: Check out this app {{applicationName}}, which can help us contain COVID-19! {{appDownloadLink}}

home.check_if_your_symptoms: Enter your symptoms and get an instant recommendation on how to stay safe.
home.did_you_test_positive: Did you test positive for COVID-19?
home.have_a_positive_test: Have a positive test result code?
home.if_you_have_a_code: Report your result to help keep your community safe.
home.location_info_body_1: The Exposure Notification technology uses Bluetooth scanning to understand what devices are near one another. On all phones running Android 6.0 and above, to use Bluetooth scanning, the device location setting needs to be turned on for all apps, not just apps built with the Exposure Notifications System.
home.location_info_subheader_1: Why do I need my location turned on?
home.proximity_tracing_info_body_1: If smartphones with the app installed are turned on, have Bluetooth enabled, and are near each other for a period of time, an encounter is registered on your device.
home.proximity_tracing_info_body_2: In the event of an encounter, your data, and information remain anonymous. The app doesn’t store any personal data. Only random IDs are exchanged. These are deleted within 14 days.

proximity_tracing.unauthorized_error_message_android: To enable Exposure Notifications, go to the COVID-19 Exposure Notifications of your Settings App and enable 'Use Exposure Notifications'
proximity_tracing.unauthorized_error_message_ios: To enable Exposure Notifications, go to the Exposure Notification section in Settings and Share Exposure Information and set the Active Region to {{applicationName}}

home.to_submit_your_test: To get your test result code, you'll need to speak with a contact tracer.

onboarding.app_setup_complete_body: {{applicationName}} is active. Thank you for helping break the chain of infection.
onboarding.app_setup_incomplete_body: {{applicationName}} requires Exposure Notifications and Bluetooth permissions to know when  and where you have been exposed to COVID 19. You can authorize this in Settings.
onboarding.app_setup_incomplete_location_body: {{applicationName}} requires Exposure Notifications, Bluetooth, and Location permissions to know when and where you have been exposed to COVID 19. You can authorize this in Settings.
onboarding.eula_agree_terms_of_use: I agree that I have read and accepted the terms of use
onboarding.location_alert_body: To use Bluetooth scanning, the device location setting needs to be turned on.
onboarding.location_body: To use Bluetooth scanning, the device location setting needs to be turned on. The app does not use your location data and your individual device cannot be tracked.
onboarding.location_subheader: Why do I need to turn on my phone's location setting?
onboarding.notification_body1: You’ll receive notifications when you may have crossed paths with someone who has reported positive for COVID-19.
onboarding.notification_body2: The app does this using Bluetooth Low Energy and secure random codes without knowing who you are or where you’ve been. You can turn this off at any time in settings.
onboarding.notification_header: Get notified if you may have been exposed
onboarding.notification_subheader3: This app does not protect you from COVID-19 infection.

protect_privacy.body_1: These IDs do not contain any personal information and change every 10-20 minutes to protect your identity.
protect_privacy.body_2: Phones swap random IDs with other devices using Bluetooth Low Energy. This allows {{applicationName}} to keep track of your daily encounters anonymously, even when you don’t have it open on your device.
protect_privacy.body_3: After testing positive for COVID-19, users can share a passcode with {{applicationName}} to verify their diagnosis. Their phone’s recent random IDs are flagged and securely uploaded to the server. This verification process helps prevent false positive reports.
protect_privacy.body_4: If a flagged ID matches with an ID stored on your phone, this indicates you may have encountered someone who has tested positive for COVID-19. This is how {{applicationName}} can determine if you may have been exposed to the virus.
protect_privacy.body_5:
If there’s a match, {{applicationName}} will notify you and provide further guidance from your health department.

This is how {{applicationName}} can empower you to make decisions about your health, and keep your community safe, all without knowing who you are or where you’ve been.
protect_privacy.subheader_1: When you turn on Exposure Notifications, your phone is tagged with frequently-changing, random IDs
protect_privacy.subheader_2: Phones with Exposure Notifications enabled swap IDs with other devices they encounter
protect_privacy.subheader_3: When a user tests positive, they can choose to anonymously share their health status
protect_privacy.subheader_4: Each phone periodically pings the server for the list of flagged IDs and looks for matches
protect_privacy.subheader_5: You will be notified if {{applicationName}} finds a positive match with a flagged ID

onboarding.proximity_tracing_body1: If smartphones with the app installed are turned on, have bluetooth enabled, and are near each other for a period of time, an encounter is registered on your device.
onboarding.proximity_tracing_body2: In the event of an encounter, your data, and information remain anonymous. The app doesn’t store any personal data. Only random IDs are exchanged. These are deleted within 14 days.
onboarding.proximity_tracing_subheader3: This app does not protect you from COVID-19 infection.
onboarding.screen1_header: Together, we can slow the spread of COVID-19.
onboarding.screen1_image_label: Two people high fiving each other
onboarding.screen2_header: Your phone remembers other devices it meets, but it won’t identify you to anyone.
onboarding.screen3_header: No personally identifiable information ever leaves your phone.
onboarding.screen3_image_label: A person in front of a locked phone
onboarding.screen4_header: The app will notify you if you may have been exposed to COVID 19
onboarding.screen4_image_label: A person getting a notification on their phone
onboarding.screen5_header: With the app, you can help slow the spread of COVID-19, protect others, and get help directly from health experts.
onboarding.screen5_image_label: A person talking to a health expert virtually
onboarding.welcome_image_label: An illustration of people with masks on, connected like nodes in a network.

call_emergency_services.urgent_medical_attention_needed: Urgent medical attention may be needed. Please call {{emergencyPhoneNumber}} or go to the Emergency Department

emergency_symptoms.are_you_experiencing: Are you experiencing any of these emergency symptoms?
emergency_symptoms.chest_pain: Severe, constant chest pain or pressure

general_symptoms.are_you_experiencing: Are you experiencing any of these symptoms?
general_symptoms.loss_of_smell_taste_appetite: Sustained loss of smell, taste, or appetite

guidance.call_your_healthcare_provider: Call your healthcare provider, clinician advice line, or telemedicine provider within 24 hours.
guidance.dont_go_to_work: Do not go to work, school, or public areas.
guidance.dont_use_public_transport: Do not use public transportation or ride sharing.
guidance.drink_water: Drink plenty of water and other clear liquids to prevent fluid loss (dehydration).
guidance.feeling_fine: Good to hear you’re feeling fine. You shuold monitor your symptoms and stay at home.
guidance.follow_cdc_guidance: If you develop symptoms, follow CDC guidance.
guidance.if_symptoms_develop: If you develop any COVID-19 symptoms or if you start to feel worse, call your healthcare provider, clinician advice line, or telemedicine provider.
guidance.may_help_you_feel_better: Here are some steps that may help you feel better:
guidance.monitor_your_symptoms: Sorry you’re feeling ill. Stay at home and monitor your symptoms. Call your provider if you get worse symptoms, stay at home.
guidance.protect_others: Take these steps to help protect others from getting sick.
guidance.seek_medical_care: If you think it is an emergency or you feel worse, seek medical care.
guidance.stay_6_feet_away: Stay at least 6 feet away from others and stay out of crowded places.
guidance.stay_at_home: Stay at home except to get medical care.
guidance.stay_away_from_higher_risk_people: If possible, stay away from people who are at higher risk for getting very sick from COVID-19.
guidance.take_care_of_yourself: Learn how to take care of yourself or someone else who is sick.
guidance.take_temperature: Take your temperature twice a day and watch for symptoms of COVID-19.
guidance.you_have_underlying_conditions: Sorry you’re not feeling well. Your symptoms may be related to COVID-19. You also have medical conditions that may put you at risk of becoming more seriously ill.
guidance.your_symptoms_might_be_related: Sorry you’re not feeling well. Your symptoms may be related to COVID-19.

intro.find_out_how_to_care: Find out how to care for yourself and others after close contact with someone positive for COVID-19
intro.if_this_is: If this is an emergency, please call {{emergencyPhoneNumber}}
intro.this_is_based_on: This is based on the latest guidance from the CDC and may be updated over time as we learn move about how the virus spreads and the illness it causes
intro.this_is_not_intended: This is not intended for diagnosis or treatment
intro.you_are_a_resident: You are a resident of the community supported by {{ healthAuthorityName }}

underlying_conditions.blood_disorder: Blood disorder, such as sickle cell disease or thalassemia
underlying_conditions.cerebrovascular_disease: Cerebrovascular disease or neurological condition, such as stroke or dementia
underlying_conditions.do_you_have: Do you have any of the following conditions?
underlying_conditions.heart_condition: Serious heart condition, such as heart failure, coronary artery disease, or cardiomyopathy
underlying_conditions.lung_disease: Chronic lung disease, such as moderate to sever asthma, COPD, cystic fibrosis, or pulmonary fibrosis
underlying_conditions.weakened_immune_system: Weakened immune system or taking medications that may cause immune suppression

settings.delete_data_disclosure1: When you tap the "Delete My Data" button below, we'll remove the data that the app has stored on your phone.
settings.delete_data_disclosure2:
This button does not delete the Rotating Proximity Identifiers or Temporary Exposure Keys created or collected by your phone for Proximity Tracing.

You can delete additional data through your phone's Settings.

errors.deleting_data: Sorry, we could not delete your data

settings.share_anonymized_data_disclaimer: By proceeding, you agree to share anonymized answers to screening questions with the {{healthAuthorityName}}
settings.share_anonymized_data_para:
Your anonymous data helps the {{healthAuthorityName}} Commission analyze, track, and contain the spread of COVID-19. Your data will be aggregated with data from other users who choose to share.

Your data contains your survey responses and zipcode, but no additional or personally-identifying information.

 The {{healthAuthorityName}} will retain your anonymous data for a specific period of time.

errors.adding_symptoms: Sorry, we could not log your symptoms
errors.deleting_symptom_log: Sorry, we could not delete the symptoms log
errors.updating_symptoms: Sorry, we could not update your symptoms

symptom_checker.to_protect_your_privacy: To protect your privacy, logs are stored on your device and deleted automatically after {{days}} days.
